EmailTemplate.subject: Pivotal Cloud Native Java Workshop Confirmation
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[http://pivotal.io/event/cloud-native-java-workshop]]> Thank you for signing up for the Pivotal Cloud Native Java workshop dedicated to your organization.
Please bring your laptop and power cord to fully participate in this workshop. A Mac or Linux environment is ideal. For the best workshop experience, please prep your laptop prior to attending by following the prerequisites below (will take approximately 35-45 minutes):
- The accompanying code for this workshop is on Github Microservices, and involves a lot of moving parts. Make sure we can run all those things in this lab. - You will need JDK 8, Git, Maven, an IDE and Docker Toolbox in order to follow along. - Specify important environment variables before opening any IDEs. Set JAVA_HOME to where the JDK is. If you're on OSX you can have it set with: export JAVA_HOME=`/usr/libexec/java_home`. - Create an environment variable called DOCKER_HOST that points to your Docker Toolbox machine. On OSX and Windows this will resolve to a virtual machine running in VirtualBox. If you're on OSX you can have it set with: export DOCKER_HOST=`docker-machine ip default`. - Install the Cloud Foundry CLI. - Go to the Spring Initializr and specify the latest stable (non-SNAPSHOT) version of Spring Boot, click the link Switch to the full version, and then choose EVERY checkbox, then click Generate Project. - In the shell, run mvn -DskipTests=true clean install to force the resolution of all those dependencies so you're not stalled later. Then, run mvn clean install to force the resolution of the test scoped dependencies. You may discard this project after you've installed everything. - Run redis.sh, redis-cli.sh, and graphite.sh of the .sh scripts in the ./bin directory of the cloned Git repository for this workshop. Run bin/psql.sh after you've run bin/postgresh.sh and confirm that they all complete and emit no obvious errors. - Very Important: go to Pivotal Web Services <[[https://run.pivotal.io/]]> and sign up for a Free Trial, you'll need an account to see this through to the end. No credit card is required, though you'll need a valid phone number.
If you have any questions related to the workshop, please contact mdougados@pivotal.io <[[mailto:mdougados@pivotal.io]]>.
Kind regards, The Pivotal Team
